plugins.name: Aspect Ratio
plugins.description:
Aspect Ratio is a Figma plugin that lets you quickly resize frames to fit both popular and custom aspect ratios. Whether you‚Äôre working with standard ratios like 16:9 or 4:3, or you need a specific custom ratio, Aspect Ratio has you covered.


How to Use It:

  1. Select a Frame: Begin by selecting any frame in your Figma workspace that you want to resize.
  2. Open the Plugin: Launch the Aspect Ratio plugin from your Figma plugins menu.
  3. Choose an Aspect Ratio:

‚Ü≥ Predefined Ratios: Click on one of the predefined aspect ratio buttons to instantly apply that ratio to your selected frame.

‚Ü≥ Custom Ratio: If you need a specific ratio, simply enter your desired width-to-height ratio in the custom ratio field, and it will be applied immediately.

4.Automatic Resizing: The plugin automatically resizes the selected frame based on the aspect ratio you choose, whether it‚Äôs a predefined or custom ratio, with no need for additional confirmation.

accepted.name: Nahuel del Valle
accepted.description: UX/UI designer oriented on visual design & design systems.

plugins.tagline: Select any frame in Figma and instantly resize it to popular or custom aspect ratios.

plugins.name: Find & Replace Words - Frames & Sections
plugins.description:
Hey designers! Tired of hunting down text in your Figma projects? We've got you covered with our new plugin that makes finding and replacing text a breeze.


Here's how it works:


  1. Pick the frames or sections you want to search through.
  2. Type in what you're looking for.
  3. Want it to be case-sensitive? Just tick the box.
  4. Hit "Find text" and watch it go to work.
  5. Boom! It'll show you how many matches it found
  6. Need to swap out some text? No problem - our replace feature has your back.


Whether you're knee-deep in a massive project or just need to make a quick tweak, this plugin's got you. It's all about making your life easier and your workflow smoother. Give it a shot and see how much time you can save!


Don't forget to rate this plugin if you find it useful.


Follow me for more updates:

X (Twitter) | LinkedIn
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Texts in Figma Frames and Sections

plugins.name: PDF Fusion
plugins.description:
// Only works on Desktop app and not on browser. //


This plugin is designed to streamline the process of exporting multi-page PDFs directly from Figma. It offers a seamless solution for designers looking to manage document exports efficiently with advanced features like:


Multi-Page PDF Export

Easily export selected frames as a single, multi-page PDF without leaving Figma.


File Compression

Optimize your PDF file size with built-in compression options, ensuring that your exports are lightweight without sacrificing quality.

Custom Page Reordering: Drag and drop to reorder pages before export, giving you complete control over the sequence of your final document.


User-Friendly Interface

The intuitive UI makes it easy to select frames, adjust the export settings, and generate the final PDF in just a few clicks.


Perfect for designers who frequently work with multi-frame designs and need flexibility in exporting PDF files with precision and efficiency.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly export multi-page PDFs with compression and custom page order in Figma.

117268.release_notes:
The selection list now displays frames with the newest selection at the bottom, reversing the previous behavior that caused confusion. This ensures a more intuitive experience when organizing selected frames.

The draggable feature now operates smoothly, making it easier to reorder frames.

Added visual cues for drop zones, providing clarity on where a frame will be placed.

Introduced "Explicitly Moved" badges to indicate frames you intentionally reordered.

Added "Moved" badges for frames whose positions were indirectly adjusted due to your reordering actions. These badges help users easily track changes in the selection order.
117268.tagline: Effortlessly export multi-page PDFs with compression and custom page order in Figma.

plugins.name: Tokenify -  Replace Colors with Tokens
plugins.description:
It automates the process of replacing colors in your designs with pre-defined color tokens. Whether you're working with frames, shapes, or text, this plugin ensures consistency across your design by utilizing color tokens from your selected collections.


How It Works


Fetch Token Collections üì¶:

The plugin fetches all local variable collections (tokens) available in the Figma file and presents them in a dropdown for selection.


Recursive Token Resolution üîç:

The plugin resolves token values recursively, ensuring that even nested or aliased tokens are accurately identified and utilized.


Scoping and Application üéØ:

Tokens can be scoped to specific properties such as FRAME_FILL, SHAPE_FILL, TEXT_FILL, STROKE_COLOR. The plugin respects these scopes, applying tokens only to appropriate elements.

Users can specify which properties (fills, strokes) should be considered for replacement via checkboxes.


Processing Nodes üåê:

The plugin traverses all selected nodes, including those nested within frames and groups, ensuring comprehensive coverage.

For each node, it determines the type (frame, shape, text) and checks if the fill, stroke, or effect colors match any tokens in the selected collection.


Replacement with Tokens üîÑ:

If a match is found, the corresponding color in the node is replaced with the token, ensuring that the design stays consistent with the defined color system.


Features


Ease of Use üõ†Ô∏è:

Simple UI to select token collections and specify scoping preferences.

Automatically fetches and displays all local variable collections in the Figma file.


Comprehensive Coverage üñåÔ∏è:

Supports fills, strokes, and effects.

Processes all nodes within selected frames and groups.


Precision üé®:

Respects token scopes to apply them only to relevant properties.

Recursively resolves token values to ensure accuracy.


How to Use


Select Nodes:

Select the frames, shapes, or text nodes you want to update in your Figma file.


Run the Plugin:

Open the plugin from the Figma Plugins menu.

Select the desired token collection from the dropdown.


Set Preferences:

Choose which properties to update (fills, strokes) using the checkboxes.


Replace Colors:

Click the "Replace Colors" button. The plugin will traverse the selected nodes, resolve token values, and update the colors based on the selected preferences


Example Use Cases


Consistent Theming üåà:

Ensure all elements in your design adhere to a consistent color theme by replacing arbitrary HEX values with predefined tokens.

Design System Integration üñºÔ∏è:


Seamlessly integrate your designs with a design system that uses tokens for color management.


Quick Updates ‚ö°:

Easily update the color scheme across multiple elements without manually changing each one.


Get Started


Install the Plugin:

Load the plugin into Figma by following the standard plugin installation steps.


Run and Enjoy:

Simplify your color management process and maintain design consistency with ease!


Happy designing! üé®‚ú®
plugins.tagline: Replace color styles, tokens and any color values for fill(s) and border(s) with tokens

plugins.name: BM i18n
plugins.description:
A powerful tool designed to streamline internationalization (i18n) workflows. With a range of features, it simplifies the management of multilingual content, enables efficient text editing, and facilitates seamless exporting of i18n resources.


a. i18n item management

  1. Create and edit i18n items effortlessly, incorporating i18n common features like plurals, variables, and formatting.
  2. Collaborate seamlessly by sharing and updating i18n items between Figma files, as if you were working with Figma components.


b. Text content editing

  1. Assign i18n keys to Figma text layers with ease. Choose to search manually or let the plugin automate the assignment process.
  2. Effortlessly edit variables, apply plurals, and format your Figma text layers, adding a touch of flair and perfection to your translations.
  3. Seamlessly switch between different languages within your designs. Explore and evaluate how your interface looks and feels in various languages, ensuring a delightful user experience for all.


c. Exporting made simple

  1. Generate JSON Language files effortlessly, fully supporting the i18next JSON format v4 and the i18n-js format. Copy and integrate the exported code into your development workflow effortlessly, saving you valuable time and effort.
  2. Overcome Figma's viewer plugin limitations with ease. Annotate keys of texts directly on the canvas, providing developers with intuitive reference points, eliminating the need for searching or memorization.
plugins.tagline: A powerful tool designed to streamline internationalization (i18n) workflows.

plugins.name: Random Opacity
plugins.description:
With Random Opacity, you can add a bit of magic to your designs. This delightful Figma plugin randomly assigns an opacity to a selection of objects, creating a unique and captivating look.


Random Opacity currently only works on directly selected objects - not child objects. So if you have a group of objects and want to randomly assign different opacity to each member of the group just make sure you select each object within the group.
plugins.tagline: Let's you randomly assign opacity to a large selection of objects in one go

plugins.name: Token Collector
plugins.description:
1. Creates variable collections from local color styles (only solid fill styles for now), with the option to bind the variables to the styles
  2. Shows variable bindings for local color styles
  3. Builds design tokens JSON from both local styles and local collection variables -- Local styles JSON output now includes composite typography tokens
  4. JSON view has options for showing font sizes in either px or rem (1rem defaults to 16px for now) and replacing raw values with variable alias


Example JSON tokens built from local styles:


{
  "color": {
    "app": {
      "primary": {
        "name": "color/app/primary",
        "description": "App primary color",
        "type": "color",
        "value": "#041c2c"
      },
      "secondary": {
        "name": "color/app/secondary",
        "description": "",
        "type": "color",
        "value": "#041c2c"
      },
      "accent": {
        "name": "color/app/accent",
        "description": "",
        "type": "color",
        "value": "#3169bb"
      }
    }
  },
  "typography": {
    "body": {
      "name": "typography/body",
      "description": "Default body text",
      "type": "text",
      "value": {
        "font-size": "0.75rem",
        "font-family": "Inter",
        "font-style": "Regular",
        "text-decoration": "none",
        "letter-spacing": "0%",
        "line-height": "auto",
        "text-transform": "none"
      }
    }
  }
}


Color tokens with option selected to replace value with alias:


{
  "color": {
    "app": {
      "primary": {
        "name": "color/app/primary",
        "description": "App primary color",
        "type": "color",
        "value": "{color.app.primary}"
      },
      "secondary": {
        "name": "color/app/secondary",
        "description": "",
        "type": "color",
        "value": "{color.app.secondary}"
      },
      "accent": {
        "name": "color/app/accent",
        "description": "",
        "type": "color",
        "value": "{color.app.accent}"
      }
    }
  }
}

plugins.name: Auto Variable
plugins.description:
Detect and bind collection variables to layer styles by highlighting your layers and setting your target collections. Any layer values (width, height, padding, corner radius, layer gap) that have matching variable values in the target collection will be automatically converted to the appropriate variables.


Instructions


// Linking/detecting variables in bulk

- Select all the layers you want to affect

- Assign the target collections for each style you want to change to variables and click the Run button.

- For example if you have a variable collection for border radius values, you can assign that as the target collection for the ‚ÄúCorner radius‚Äù style property. Then when you click ‚ÄúRun‚Äù any manual values that match a variable in the target collection will be linked/converted to the matching variable.


// Unlinking variables in bulk

- Select all the layers you want to affect

- Select ‚ÄúUnliked‚Äù as the target collection for a style properties you want to unlink from variables, and click the Run button.

- For example, if can select 100 layers, and specify the Corner Radius target collection as ‚ÄúUnliked‚Äù, when you click ‚ÄúRun‚Äù, border radius styles for all 100 layers will be unlinked (if applicable) from their variables and would now just be normal manual style values.
plugins.tagline: Detect and bind collection variables to layer styles

plugins.name: HTML Tags & Attributes ‚Äî attach semantic data to your design and ensure a seamless dev handoff
plugins.description:
The "HTML Tags and Attributes' offers a semantic approach to design in Figma, enabling you to infuse your elements with HTML semantics (HTML tags and attributes like 'h1, header, main, menu, class', id...ARIA).


By allowing the attachment of tags and attributes and data to design elements, it bridges the gap between visual design and web development. This plugin not only enhances the design-to-development workflow but also fosters interoperability among plugins, ensuring that design data is rich, accessible, and translatable into code. Whether it's applying common attributes or specific ARIA labels, "Tags and Attributes' empowers you to create more meaningful, web-ready designs.


Please leave your issues and suggestions in the comments.


Features

====================


  • Semantic Tagging: Attach HTML tags to design elements for semantic. (h1,h2....header, footer...span, menu...)
  • Attribute Assignment: Assign common and tag-specific attributes to elements. (class, id, href.....)
  • ARIA Support: Enhance accessibility with ARIA attribute integration. (role...aria-describedby...)
  • Interoperability: Share data across plugins with setSharedPluginData, enhancing collaborative capabilities.


       
   const attributes = node.getSharedPluginData('figma.attributes', 'attributes');

   // attributes object will be like this { tag: 'h2', attributes: {id: 'main-title', class: 'heading'} }


  • Dual Inspect Modes:
  • On Frame Overlay: Visualize HTML semantics directly on the design canvas.
  • On Layer Inspection: View attached tags and attributes in the Layers panel, with tags prefixed for easy identification.
  • Visualization, SEO and Audit features will come later
  • Multi Edit: Simultaneously edit tags and attributes across multiple elements, streamlining the design process.
  • Component Tag & Attribute Inheritance: Tags and attributes attached to a component automatically propagate to all instances, ensuring semantic consistency across your design.



Supported plugins

====================

1) The "figma.to.website" plugin will extract data from your markup and generate semantic code.



Possible Use Cases

====================



  • Accessibility Auditing: Designers can ensure their designs meet accessibility standards by using ARIA tags and attributes, facilitating an accessible web right from the design phase.
  • Design-to-Development Handoff: Developers can quickly understand the semantic structure of a design, speeding up HTML/CSS coding processes.
  • Educational Tool: Helps new designers and developers learn HTML and CSS semantics by applying them directly in a visual design context.
  • Collaborative Design Review: Teams can review designs with semantic tags and attributes visible, ensuring that design intentions are clearly communicated.
  • Plugin Collaboration: Other Figma plugins can access the semantic data for various purposes, such as generating code snippets or enhancing design documentation.
  • Quality Assurance: Facilitate the QA process by providing clear semantics for testing scripts and automation tools, ensuring that all elements are correctly implemented and accessible.
  • Content Strategy Development: Strategize content hierarchy and SEO through the application of header tags (h1, h2, etc.), helping content strategists plan out the information architecture.
  • Style Guide Creation: Automatically generate a comprehensive style guide that includes HTML/CSS attributes, helping developers understand the design system's semantics.
  • Internationalization and Localization: Easily tag text elements with language attributes, assisting in the preparation of designs for multi-language support and localization.


Here's how you can contribute:

A quick and easy way to show your appreciation to is by buying me a coffee. This one-time contribution fuels my passion and helps maintain the development of the plugin.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/lucksy


Happy Designing!

accepted.name: Amila Sampath
accepted.description: Hi, I'm Amila. I design & build user interfaces.

plugins.tagline: Attach & transform designs with semantic HTML, ensuring accessibility & seamless dev handoff.

plugins.name: Flash Setup PRO
plugins.description:
üåü Welcome to the Figma Page Organizer Plugin! üåü

This plugin lets you swiftly create, organize, and remove pages, keeping your workspace neat and tidy! üöÄ


üåà How to Use Flash Setup PRO:

Add Page Names:

  • Type the name of the new page into the text field.
  • Click the Insert button to add the name to the list. üìù
  • To add a divider, click the Add Row button. It will be added to the list as "---------------------------------". üåø
  • Remember, page names and dividers can be reordered by dragging them in the list! üîÑ


Generate Pages:

  • After adding all desired names, click the Generate Pages button to create the pages in Figma. üéâ
  • If a page named "Page 1" exists, it will be renamed to the first name on your list! ü•á
  • Dividers are added as pages but can be added multiple times without name changes. üåü

Remove Pages:

  • Click the Remove Pages button to delete all pages from the list, except the first one, which will be renamed to "Page 1". üóëÔ∏è
  • This step will reset your Figma file to the default state with a single page named "Page 1". üîÑ


üåü Quick Tips:

  • üö´ Avoid Duplicates: The plugin won't allow you to add duplicate page names, so no worries!
  • üîÑ Reorder with Ease: You can reorder page names and dividers in the list simply by dragging them.
  • üåø Flexible Dividers: Use dividers to visually organize your pages. They can be added multiple times!


üéâ All set! Now you know how to use the Figma Page Organizer Plugin! Enjoy organizing your pages! üéâ
plugins.tagline: Flash Setup PRO Organize, Craft, and Transform: Figma Pages in a Click!

plugins.name: Export to Threads
plugins.description:
Tired of hacking together multiple tools to share your work and get feedback on it? Now you can export Figma frames to Threads to share designs with your team, gather feedback in one place, and present your work.


How it works

  1. Download the Mac desktop app and sign into Threads
  2. Go to your organization on the top left of Threads
  3. Use the drop-down and select Integrations
  4. Under Personal Apps find Figma and press Sign in
  5. Follow the set up instructions
  6. Once you're set up, select Figma frames you want to get feedback on, or present, and press cmd+; to run the plugin and send the frames to the Threads desktop app
  7. Add context to the frames, tag your teammates, or add video narration to walk through them


You can also interact with a Figma prototype directly in Threads by copying it and pasting it into a thread.


What is Threads

Threads is a Slack replacement designed for makers. To get early access to Threads, you can sign up here: https://threads.com/


Help articles

  1. How do I install the plugin?
  2. How do I import frames?

plugins.name: LayeReName
plugins.description:
LayeReName is a Figma plugin designed to simplify and streamline the process of renaming layers and text content within your Figma projects. This simple yet powerful tool offers five renaming options:

  • Title Case: Capitalizes the first letter of each word, except for pre-defined excluded words (articles, prepositions, conjunctions).
  • All Caps: Converts all characters to uppercase.
  • Lower Case: Converts all characters to lowercase.
  • Title Case All: Capitalizes the first letter of every word, without any exceptions.
  1. Capitalize: Capitalizes the first letter of each sentence, detecting sentence endings based on punctuation marks such as '.', '!', '?' and ':'.

With LayeReName, you can also choose to rename the content of text layers by toggling the "Rename content of Text Layer" option. This feature allows you to maintain control over capitalization and naming conventions across your entire project.
plugins.tagline: LayeReName: Streamline layer & text renaming in Figma for consistent, efficient designs.

plugins.name: Tab Text Override
plugins.description:
Tab through every text override in your selection. Stop mousing around!


How to use: 


  • Select any text element, symbol(s), etc. 
  • Hit Cmd + T
  • Start typing to override first text element within selection.
  • Tab to select the next text element to override, or Shift + Tab to go to previous text element.
  • Enter to save and close.
  • Esc to revert last edited text element and close.


To add a line break, hit Option + Enter.


To buy me a coffee, venmo @dbilyk :)


Hope someone can find this useful!


Note: This plugin currently only works on text elements that have exactly ONE font for all characters in the text element.

plugins.name: Composables to Code
plugins.description:
Quickly export a node hierarchy as composables with a customizable mapping for your design system.


This plugin isn't focused on generating pixel-perfect code that mirrors everything Figma offers.

Instead, it's designed to save you from the repetitive task of constantly writing Column, Row, Text, ...,

and renaming components or variables to match your design system in code.


Currently Supported Features


  1. solid colors on texts, borders and backgrounds
  2. simple texts with one styling
  3. Row, Column, Box, Text, and FlowRow nodes
  4. box nodes as a fallback for icons or images
  5. baseline alignment of texts
  6. weight(1f) modifier on child nodes of Row or Column
  7. fixed sizing modifiers
  8. mapping of local variables (only paddings)
  9. mapping of text and color styles
  10. retain the original name of the nodes as a comment


Bugs or Feature Requests?


You can either leave a comment

or write an email to hey@letsprescribe.company.

If you encounter any bug, please attach a *.fig file as a reference.


Source: https://github.com/lets-prescribe/composables-to-code
plugins.tagline: Map and Export your Design to Composables

plugins.name: Statusup: Status management
plugins.description:
üí´ Assign, Update and Monitor task and design statuses progress in Figma.


Statuses are added to the name of page, sections, frames, groups and components and updated when the plugin is restarted.


üí• Available:

  1. 20 statuses
  2. Quick commands
  3. Fast update status
  4. Multiselection layers
  5. List of active statuses (command "summary")


üëã Statuses:

  1. üü¢ ‚Ä∫ Done
  2. üü† ‚Ä∫ Blocked
  3. üü° ‚Ä∫ In Process
  4. üîµ ‚Ä∫ In Development
  5. üü£ ‚Ä∫ Need Review
  6. üü§ ‚Ä∫ In Testing
  7. üî¥ ‚Ä∫ Cancel
  8. ‚ö™ ‚Ä∫ Archive
  9. ‚ö´ ‚Ä∫ Backlog
  10. üèÅ ‚Ä∫ Final
  11. üõ†Ô∏è ‚Ä∫ Draft
  12. üóë ‚Ä∫ Trash
  13. üí° ‚Ä∫ Idea
  14. üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è ‚Ä∫ No use
  15. ‚ùó ‚Ä∫ No delete
  16. ‚úÖ ‚Ä∫ In Release
  17. üëÅÔ∏è‚Ä∫ Reference
  18. üí† ‚Ä∫ Ready to Dev
  19. üëÄ ‚Ä∫ Moodboard;
  20. ‚úèÔ∏è ‚Ä∫ Design system;


This all speeds up the search for statuses, use the keyboard shortcut "Command + F" / "Ctrl + /" for quick searches.


How use?

You define and interpret the statuses of tasks and designs independently. To make it easier to use in a team, we recommend to describe the meaning of each status in the team wiki.


How I use it:

  1. {‚ùó ‚Ä∫ No delete} - For frames and sections that cannot be deleted
  2. {üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è ‚Ä∫ No use} - For components that cannot be used in layouts
  3. {üóë ‚Ä∫ Trash} - Layouts to be deleted

plugins.name: TODO comments
plugins.description:
TODO Comments is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design workflow by transforming comments into actionable tasks. With TODO Comments, you can effortlessly manage and keep track of all your tasks directly within your Figma file.


Key Features:


‚Ä¢Automatic Task Generation: The plugin scans your Figma file for comments starting with ‚ÄúTODO‚Äù and generates a comprehensive task list.

‚Ä¢Task Management: Easily mark tasks as resolved, respond to comments, and manage your workflow efficiently.

‚Ä¢User Assignment: Assign tasks to yourself or other team members by mentioning them in the comment using the format TODO @username: Task description.

‚Ä¢Categorized Lists: Tasks are categorized by assignment, allowing you to quickly see which tasks are unassigned, assigned to you, or assigned to others.


How to Use:


  1. Install the Plugin: Add TODO Comments to your Figma plugins.
  2. Add Your Credentials: Enter your fileKey and access token to enable the plugin to access and manage your comments.
  3. Add TODO Comments: Simply start any comment with ‚ÄúTODO‚Äù in your Figma file to create a task.
  4. Assign Tasks: Mention a team member in the comment to assign the task to them. For example, TODO @Marcos: Change this button.
  5. Manage Tasks: Open the TODO Comments plugin to view, manage, and resolve tasks.
plugins.tagline: Tturns comments in Figma into a task list. Mark tasks as resolved, respond, and assign users!

plugins.name: Roadmap
plugins.description:
To work with the plugin, you need to upload a JSON file containing the following structure:


1. name: an array of objects, each representing the name of a company.

- name: a string containing the name of the company.


2. goals: an array of objects, each describing an annual goal for the company.

- name: a string describing a specific goal.

- color: a string in HEX format representing a color associated with the goal for visual representation.


3. departmentTasks: an array of objects, each containing information about departmental tasks by month.

- department: a string indicating the name of the department to which the task belongs.

- month: a number indicating the month in which the task is to be completed.

- date: a string representing the specific date of task completion in DD.MM format.

- task: a string describing the task.

- performer: a string, the name of the task performer.

- group: a string indicating the group or team to which the performer belongs.

- status: a string describing the current status of the task ("–ì–æ—Ç–æ–≤–æ", "–í –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–µ", "–ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω").


Example JSON structure for the plugin:


{

"name": [

{

"name": "Company Name"

}

],

"goals": [

{

"name": "Goal Description",

"color": "HEX color code"

}

],

"departmentTasks": [

{

"department": "Department Name",

"colorDep": "HEX color code",

"month": month number,

"date": "DD.MM",

"task": "Task Description",

"performer": "Performer's Name",

"group": "Performer's Group or Team",

"status": "Current Task Status"

}

]

}



This structure allows the plugin to correctly interpret and visualize data about the company, its annual goals, and monthly departmental tasks, enhancing project management and team communication.
plugins.tagline: Making roadmap from JSON

plugins.name: Figma assets to Github plugin
plugins.description:
Description

This plugin adds the ability to export figma assets (icons, illustrations, etc) to a github repository through a pull request.


Using the plugin

Setup:

  1. Generate a personal access token in Github
  2. Inside the "Github" tab of the plugin, fill the details about the repository that will receive the exported assets and insert your personal access token
  3. Inside the "Assets" tab of the plugin, select the format the assets should be exported in (currently we only support exporting directly as SVG's or Vue Components)


Exporting:

  1. Click the export button
  2. Wait for the process to finish
  3. Check that a pull request was opened in the repository defined in "Github" tab


Read our documentation here.
plugins.tagline: A plugin that makes it simple to export assets from Figma to a Github repository.

plugins.name: Foldwrap Banner Generator
plugins.description:
Foldwrap allows you to instantly generate HTML5 animations from your Figma design.


You can animate not just a single frame, but a bunch of them at once, making it possible to animate a complete storyboard, for example an animated banner, in 1 click.


Features

  1. Instantly turn static Figma designs into animated banner ads
  2. Animate entire storyboard to deliver marketing message frame by frame
  3. Choose animation style and fine-tune individual elements
  4. Export banners in native HTML5, ready for ad networks
  5. Switch between animated and static HTML output
  6. Generate and export multiple banners at once
  7. Export into readable HTML+CSS and use code as you want
  8. Scale creatives using data from Google Sheets


How to use the plugin

  1. Select one or more frames in Figma
  2. Run the plugin and press the 'Import' button
  3. That's it! ‚ú®


If you are using your own font, you may need to upload it on Foldwrap website to make the result look as intended.


Possible incorrect results with complex shapes, filters, nested instances - simplify design in such cases.


We have a FAQ and more detailed description on a webpage

Feel free to contact creator directly if you have any questions.
plugins.tagline: Animate Storyboards and Banners in 1 click

plugins.name: DSync
plugins.description:
This plugin helps the designers and developers to automate the process of syncing Figma design system changes straight to the codebase design system.


It is quite useful for the designers to make changes in the design system without notifying developers about each change. Adding 10 new icons in Figma can now be easily transformed to the code as files with one click instead of exporting them manually by the developer. Changing the accent color will not only take effect everywhere it's used in Figma components, but also in the code components just as fast.


At the moment, the plugin works with such design tokens as

  • icons ‚Äî it searches for "COMPONENT" types on a Figma page and returns them in .svg format only
  • colors ‚Äî it searches for "PAINT" types on a Figma page and returns them in .json format
  • typography ‚Äî it searches for "TEST" types on a Figma page and returns them in .json format


For instance, if we run the plugin on the page with icons and send the changes, the PR will be creates with all the new .svg files, which are not in the base branch yet.


Plugin form has several fields which are necessary to be provided:

  • repo name ‚Äî the name of your Github repository with the code design system
  • your Github token ‚Äî here are the instructions of how to create it)
  • owner name ‚Äî your Github nickname if you own the repo or the name of the company
  • head branch ‚Äî the name of the branch where you make the changes to your design system
  • base branch ‚Äî the name of the base branch where you are to pull your changes


By pushing the "Sync" button it pushes all found token styles to the head branch of the provided repo and creates a pull request to the main branch.


üì© Do not hesitate to suggest any additional functionality if you think the plugin might be helpful to you!

plugins.name: BestPrice.gr
plugins.description:
This plugin will populate the selected layers with product-related data (title, price and image), based on your query.

How it works:

Select layers (text or rects).

- All text layers containing $ or ‚Ç¨ will be filled with product prices.
All text layers named "descr" or "description" will be populated with product descriptions, if available.
- All text layers that are not handled as "price layers" will be filled with product tiles.
- Rects wil be filled with product covers.

Notes:
1. Too small layers are ignored.
2. Locked layers are ignored.
3. Rects without (visible) fills are ignored.

plugins.name: Select Siblings in Auto-Layout
plugins.description:
A plugin that quickly selects elements inside auto-layout frames. It allows to pick just one element and then expand the selection in numerous ways. Can be useful when dealing with long lists of layers, such as news feeds, chat interfaces and many more.


Supports the commands listed below:


Select to the Beginning

Selects all the elements located before a selected one (i. e., those positioned above or to the left of the element in an auto-layout frame).


Select to the End

Similarly, expands a selection so as it will include the elements located after a selected one (positioned below or to the right of the element).


Select Between Elements

Selects all elements located between the two nodes that have been already selected.


Expand a Selection Backward

Adds the previous element to a selection.


Expand a Selection Forward

Similarly, adds the next one.


Select the First

Basically, selects the first element in a list.


Select the Last

Does the same, but with the last element.
plugins.tagline: Quickly select elements on the same level of hierarchy

plugins.name: Tailwind Sync
plugins.description:
Tailwind Sync is a tool box that bridges Figma variables and Tailwind code, streamlining the collaboration between designers and developers, from simple projects to design systems.


Features

  1. Plug and play: Simply drag and drop the file into your code editor and start coding with the exact same theme as in Figma.
  2. Variables, not values: Tailwind Sync outputs variables instead of hardcoded values, perfect for complex, scalable design systems in enterprise environments.
  3. Built-in changelog: Automatically tracks and documents changes to variables and text styles, ensuring easy versioning and clear communication with a shared language across design & development teams
  4. Tailwind scoping: Ensures Tailwind scoping matches Figma‚Äôs, guiding developers to use values consistently, and maintain design integrity.


Tips for Using the Plugin

  1. Ignore Design-Only Folders: If your variable path includes design-specific organizational folders, place them between parenthesis (e.g., (folder)). The plugin will ignore these.
  2. Text Styles Exclusion: Aside from font-families, the plugin does not take text style-attached variables into account.
  3. Scope Tailwind Variables: You can use Figma‚Äôs scoping feature to limit your Tailwind variables to specific properties.
  4. Changelog Tokens: The tokens displayed in the changelog represent the final class that the developer will use (e.g., bg-button-primary).


For a Deeper Understanding

Check out our walkthrough videos to get started with Tailwind Sync

  1. Overview: https://x.com/source_paris/status/1836378230321779145
  2. First-time setup: https://x.com/source_paris/status/1837019103233520044
  3. Tailwind scoping: https://x.com/source_paris/status/1838262832451981433


Enjoying this plugin?

  1. Share it with your team and network
  2. Upvote on ProductHunt
  3. Drop a comment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
  4. Check out our other plugin, IconDescription

plugins.name: Style Merger
plugins.description:
Style Merger allows you apply multiple text styles to a text layer automatically based on language character sets.


Supported character sets:

  • English
  • Korean (Hangul/Hanja)
  • Japanese(Hiragana/Katakana/Kanji)
  • Chinese (Hanzi)
  • Emoji


How to use:

  • Create a local text style for each language
  • Toggle languages and set the style to apply for each language
  • Press the 'Apply styles' button while a text layer is selected to apply all text styles


Save presets:

  • Toggle and select styles on the "Styles" tab
  • From the "Settings" tab input the name of your preset and save it via the "+" button.


Load presets:

  • From the "Settings" tab press the load button to load styles from a previously saved preset.


Coming Soon

  • More language character set options
  • Support for remote library text styles
plugins.tagline: Multi-language text styles

plugins.name: URL2Design
plugins.description:
Ever wanted to quickly import an existing website's design into Figma? We felt the same, that's why we made URL2Design. Now, you can easily pull websites into Figma and start tweaking it, jumpstarting the creative process. 


URL2Design, your shortcut from the web straight into Figma elements. ‚ú®


Here‚Äôs how it works:


  1. Spot & Copy: Find a website that sparks inspiration for you or your client.
  2. Paste & Generate: Paste the link into URL2Design Figma Plugin
  3. Tweak: Instantly get the Figma elements, ready for you to tweak it.


Why URL2Design?


‚åõTime-Saver: What used to take hours of designing from scratch, now takes less than 10 minutes.

üß™Freedom to Experiment: Start with a solid base and let your creativity flow, tweaking as you see fit (or your client‚Äôs fit)

‚ö°Efficiency Boost: Spend less time recreating and more time refining and innovating.


We hope this tool brings you closer to your efficient design workflow. Happy designing! 

Curious about the tech? It‚Äôs made with love by Symph.

Tips

- You can select multiple frames at once. Each frame will get its own status badge.
